text: Okay.
Yeah, let's try again.
Hi, I'm Jeremy Yang.

I am an assistant professor of business
administration in the marketing unit
at Harvard Business School.
I work on topics in the creator economy.

Creator economy is an ecosystem for
individuals to monetize their creativity.

And then we have three main parties
in this economy.

We have the creators
who are producing the content.

We have the platform that is responsible
for content discovery and distribution.
And then we have the advertisers who are

funding this economy
through advertising dollars.

In my research,
I develop data science tools
to help creators to produce better content

and help advertisers to better match
with the creators they want to work with.

And then the platform to better serve
both creators and advertisers.
Jay-Z said "I'm not a businessman.
I'm a business, man."

So I think we are
in the very exciting time

where every individual has
the potential to become creators
and to make a living off it.

So they are developing personal brands
and becoming a business themselves.

I think it's a very interesting phenomenon
to study.

I brought this stone in the miniature
zen garden in my office.

I think it is representing
the type of person I'm trying to become,

which is someone, you know,
who has a lot of inner peace and calmness

and also the time and space to slow down
and really appreciate

and admire
things that are bigger than ourselves.
